posts.title: My Vlogs
posts.text: I’ve always wanted to learn something new for fun and am interested in video editing. So I made a plan to post 5 vlogs every year since I didn’t like myself to be so rushed or transactional, which might ruin my passion as a beginner. Four years passed, and I made 20 vlogs by CapCut or Final Cut Pro. 17 were in Chinese, and 3 were in English after I began to have new friends from other cultures. I had fun; surprisingly, my friends loved my vlogs, too. This is the vlog we were talking about Today I was suddenly curious about the data, so I gathered them from each post and summarized as below: Updated date: Nov.15, 2022, Data were from WeChat, and Instagram Not included data of 1 video posted on Youtube Total Year Posts Views Likes Comments Shares 2019 5 1955 13 1 4 2020 6 7736 114 22 8 2021 4 2926 38 9 35 2022 5 4842 116 22 21 PopularityPosts popularity varies with views ranging from 870 to 5300 and likes ranging from 0 to 92;5 most popular posts were all 1k+ views, 5.2k, 2.5k, 1.4k, 1.2k, and 1k with average each 30+ likes. EngagementMy average like-to-view ratio is 2%, 2 likes to 100 views, which increased from 1%; According to Google, above 4% is considered above average or good. So, here is my new plan: Continue to make 5 vlogs this year; See when I can make a 4%+ like-to-view video.

–Until yesterday a meaningful conversation, I had never thought a few of my weaknesses stemmed from the emotion of shame. –I might have been through an experience of limerence. Thank you, but bye, サダハルちゃん – Your results indicate that you have none or very few symptoms of Depression. Thanks!

posts.title: Denial of insurance
posts.text: I’m writing this note to help someone in the same situation who finds my blog via keyword searching.I hope my information could help you there. I was confused when I received a $252 bill from OSF health care. Another letter told me, your insurance company has denied the service in whole or part of as your responsibility After thinking a while, I remembered that on 05/14/2022, I burnt my fingers with an oven tray one day and called Mckinley Health Center for help. Mckinley Emergency agent provided service options under my insurance coverage, and I went to Heart of Mary Medical center and received the cure. But why did my student’s insurance deny the coverage? Then I called the 24/7 SAP number on my insurance card, 877-862-1172. The agent led me to the Student Resource at 800-767-0700, where agent Mel helped. She checked and explained patiently: OSF claimed to my insurance provider, UnitedHealthcare, but at the same time, the Mckinley portal hadn’t activated the coverage for the summer semester (05/14/2022 - 08/19/2022). Therefore, the solution is to reclaim. Mel submitted the form, and I got a document control number for OSF. Then I dialed OSF Healthcare at 309-683-6750. OSF also gave me another number for tracking their process, where I could dial 800-421-5700 to follow up, and usually, the bill should be covered in 20 business days. From receiving the letters to processing the resolution, it took me 30min, mostly waiting online within 5 calls, including 2 (/5 calls) not helpful because of the broken phone system sometimes leading me nowhere with the instructions.

posts.title: BQ Questions
posts.text: Dive Deep Tell me about a specific metric you used to identify a need for a change in your department. Did you create the metric, or was it already available? How did this and other information influence the change? What was the outcome of this change? Tell me about a time when you were trying to understand a complex problem on your team, and you had to dig into the details to figure it out. Tell me about a situation that required you to dig deep to get to the root cause. Think Big Tell me about a time you drove adoption for your vision/ideas. Tell me about a time when you were working on an initiative or goal and saw an opportunity to do something much bigger or better than the initial focus Be Curious Tell me about a time when you realized you needed a deeper level of subject matter expertise to do your job well. What did you do about it? What was the outcome? Is there anything you would have done differently? Tell me about a time when you didn’t know what to do next or how to solve a challenging problem Describe a time when you took on work outside of your comfort area. How did you identify what you needed to learn to be successful? How did you go about building expertise to meet your goal? Did you meet your goal? Customer Obsession Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond for a customer. Why did you do it? How did the customer respond? What was the outcome? Describe a difficult interaction you had with a customer. Customer Obsession Give me an example of a tough or critical piece of feedback you received. What was it, and what did you do about it? Tell me about a time when you had to communicate a change in direction that you

posts.text: 2022 Maybe you should talk to someone Story: Style, Structure, Substance, and the Principle of Screenwriting — Archive —By Haruki Murakami 村上春树My favorite author, Japanese writer, marathon runner, among the world’s greatest living novelists Title Wrote at his Hear the Wind Sing *（且听风吟） Pinball, 1973 *（1973 年的弹子球） A Wild Sheep Chase *（寻羊冒险记） Norwegian Wood *（挪威的森林） Kafka on the Shore *（海边的卡夫卡） After Dark *（天黑之后） What I Talk About When I Talk About Running *（当我跑步时，我谈些什么） 1Q84 60 Novelist as a Vocation *（我的职业是小说家） By Milan KunderaCzech/French writer, nominee for Nobel Prize in Literature The Farewell Waltz *告别圆舞曲 La valse aux adieux （1976） Immortality *不朽 L’Immortalité （1990） Slowness *慢 La Lenteur（1995） Mystery Novels by Keigo Higashino After School *放学后 Plan Chojin 鸟人计划 Fate 宿命 Classmate *同级生 Alter Ego 分身 Weird Laughs Novel 怪笑小说 Poisonous Laughs Novel 毒笑小说 Malice 恶意 Journey Under the Midnight Sun 白夜行 时生 The Door of Murder *杀人之门 The Devotion of Suspect X 嫌疑犯 X 的献身 Wuxia Novels by Jin Yong 金庸 射雕英雄传（1957）The Legend of the Condor Heroes 神雕侠侣（1959）The Return of the Condor Heroes 雪山飞狐（1959）Fox Volant of the Snowy Mountain 飞狐外传（1960）The Young Flying Fox 倚天屠龙记（1961）The Heaven Sword and Dragon Saber 天龙八部（1963）Demi-Gods and Semi-Devils 笑傲江湖（1963）The Smiling, Proud Wanderer 鹿鼎记（1969-1972）The Deer and the Cauldron Science Fictions Isaac Asimov: The End of Eternity( Andy Weir: The Martian Ted Chiang: Story of Your Life Liu Cixin 刘慈欣: 三体 The Three-Body Problem,流浪地球 The Wandering Earth Other Novels One Hundred Years of Solitude Gone with the wind 陀思妥耶夫斯基：白夜 无人生还 少女凑佳苗 质数的孤独你喜欢勃拉姆斯吗 牧羊少年的奇幻之旅 维罗妮卡决定去死 红楼梦 背叛 恋情的终结 1984 动物庄园 查泰来夫人的情人 王小波：红拂夜奔 Else 宇宙超度指南、冷场、脱口秀工作手册 量子物理史话 路西法效应 失控 硅谷那些事儿 Code Rush 网络素养 混合现实 乡土中国 明朝那些事儿 Stories about Ming Dynasty The History of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire罗马帝国衰亡史（前五章）

posts.title: NVIDIA Inventory
posts.text: Turnover Year NVIDIA’s Turnover 2013 5.5x 2014 4.7x 2015 4.8x 2016 4.9x 2017 4.7x 2018 4.9x 2019 3.8x 2020 3.2x 2021 4.4x 2022 4.3x Companies Turnover in 2022 NVIDIA 4.3x QUALCOMM 4.5x AMD 4.7x Microsoft 21.7x Data above was from Source NVIDIA takes 84.88 average days to sell the inventory in a year, while Microsoft only takes 21.7 days. Inventory / Operating RevenueNormally, a good inventory to revenue ratio is between 5 to 10 percent. NVIDIA’s ratio is high, suggesting a significant increase in inventory compared to the speed of sales. Year Ratio 2016 8.9% 2017 15.8% 2018 11.5% 2019 16.2% 2020 8.4% 2021 16.7% 2022 15.6% Sheet above was calculated based on Balance Sheet & Income Statement data. EOQ Caculating Parameter Value Remark Working Days 300 Annual Demand 4.8M units Carrying Cost / unit $35 * 15% Chipset Cost * Carrying cost percentage, which normally ranges from 15% - 30% Ordering Cost / unit $500 Normally 35 to 500 dollars EOQ Result Result EOQ 30,327 unit Cycle Time 2 days
